result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany Loretta Jennifer Boone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).
  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with mental health treatment, including working with a therapist or counselor. May live with mother and will leave communication with children up to the mother. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars or clubs.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 2

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: count 2

Defendant Tiffany L Boone in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Tiffany L Boone in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request an adjournment after reading the statements in the PSI.
BTC: Adjournment granted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.
ZCI report

Counts 2 and 5 only - Aggravated Battery - Elderly 940.19(6)(a), Burglary - Dwelling, Boat or Motorhome 943.10(2)(e)
Conditions: No contact with the victim RDR or JA SR. (person, property, residence or family). HOUSE ARREST w/GPS. Must live w/Ms Heath at 919 13th St., defendant may leave for court, attorney appointments and appointments at Behavioral Health Services. Comply with mental health treatment. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
